snippet: The archbishop, a champion of the poor and critic of government repression in El Salvador, was gunned down in 1980.
abstract: Pope Francis announces that hold on the beatification of Archbishop Oscar Romero has been lifted, clearing the way to honor a hero of El Salvador’s leftist opposition who was gunned down in 1980 while celebrating Mass; case had been blocked by conservative leaders in the Roman Catholic Church.

byline.original: By GENE PALUMBO and DAMIEN CAVE
byline.contributor: Gene Palumbo reported from San Salvador, and Damien Cave from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The archbishop, a champion of the poor and critic of government repression in El Salvador, was gunned down in 1980.

headline.main: An Obstacle to Honoring an Archbishop Is Removed
headline.print_headline: An Obstacle to Honoring an Archbishop Is Removed
